title: Friday Close
commentary: Supreme Court stunner: Trump tariffs struck down 6-3, sending S&P 500 surging in late-session euphoria before POTUS countered with fresh 10% global levy. Q4 GDP disappointed at 1.4% vs 2.2% expected; PCE inflation sticky at 3%. Gold pared gains on ruling, dollar set for best week since October. Oil steady near $66 as White House mulls limited Iran strike.

title: Weekend Session
commentary: Saturday overnight. Equity desks dark until Monday. Crypto markets active globally. Live data feed awaiting API configuration.

title: Weekend Session
commentary: Friday trading wrapped. US indices closed mixed; crypto trading overnight. Data feed offline—live prices resume when API is configured.

title: Weekend Session
commentary: Markets quiet as Wall Street sleeps. Crypto continues 24/7 trading; futures await Sunday's Asia open. Live data feed offline pending configuration.

title: Weekend Session
commentary: US equity markets closed for the weekend. Crypto trades 24/7 while futures resume Sunday evening. Data feed offline pending API restoration.

title: Thursday Close / Asia Early Morning
commentary: U.S. equities finished Thursday's session in the red — Dow down 0.66%, S&P 500 off 0.39% — as the post-Fed bounce ran out of steam in a broad-based retreat. Gold slipped below the psychological $5,000 level to close at exactly $5,000 (-0.19%), offering the bulls a crucial test after this week's historic run. Oil continued defying gravity at $66.53 (+2.3%) on persistent supply fears while crypto staged a modest overnight recovery — Bitcoin rallied back to $66,927 (+0.9% on 24h), though Ethereum lagged at $1,937 (-0.8%). The close sets up a pivotal Friday with gold defending the $5K handle and equities searching for direction after two days of chop.
